item.title: Privacy Policy
item.dc:creator: LCSwPaDmin
item.content:encoded:
Who we are

Our website address is: https://www.lodestarcs.org.

What personal data we collect and why we collect it

Comments

When visitors leave comments on the site we collect the data shown in the comments form, and also the visitor’s IP address and browser user agent string to help spam detection.

An anonymized string created from your email address (also called a hash) may be provided to the Gravatar service to see if you are using it. The Gravatar service privacy policy is available here: https://automattic.com/privacy/. After approval of your comment, your profile picture is visible to the public in the context of your comment.

Media

If you upload images to the website, you should avoid uploading images with embedded location data (EXIF GPS) included. Visitors to the website can download and extract any location data from images on the website.

Contact forms

Cookies

If you leave a comment on our site you may opt-in to saving your name, email address and website in cookies. These are for your convenience so that you do not have to fill in your details again when you leave another comment. These cookies will last for one year.

If you visit our login page, we will set a temporary cookie to determine if your browser accepts cookies. This cookie contains no personal data and is discarded when you close your browser.

When you log in, we will also set up several cookies to save your login information and your screen display choices. Login cookies last for two days, and screen options cookies last for a year. If you select "Remember Me", your login will persist for two weeks. If you log out of your account, the login cookies will be removed.

If you edit or publish an article, an additional cookie will be saved in your browser. This cookie includes no personal data and simply indicates the post ID of the article you just edited. It expires after 1 day.

Embedded content from other websites

Articles on this site may include embedded content (e.g. videos, images, articles, etc.). Embedded content from other websites behaves in the exact same way as if the visitor has visited the other website.

These websites may collect data about you, use cookies, embed additional third-party tracking, and monitor your interaction with that embedded content, including tracking your interaction with the embedded content if you have an account and are logged in to that website.

Analytics

Who we share your data with

If you request a password reset, your IP address will be included in the reset email.

How long we retain your data

If you leave a comment, the comment and its metadata are retained indefinitely. This is so we can recognize and approve any follow-up comments automatically instead of holding them in a moderation queue.

For users that register on our website (if any), we also store the personal information they provide in their user profile. All users can see, edit, or delete their personal information at any time (except they cannot change their username). Website administrators can also see and edit that information.

What rights you have over your data

If you have an account on this site, or have left comments, you can request to receive an exported file of the personal data we hold about you, including any data you have provided to us. You can also request that we erase any personal data we hold about you. This does not include any data we are obliged to keep for administrative, legal, or security purposes.

Where we send your data

Visitor comments may be checked through an automated spam detection service.

Your contact information

Additional information

How we protect your data

What data breach procedures we have in place

What third parties we receive data from

What automated decision making and/or profiling we do with user data

Industry regulatory disclosure requirements

item.title: Home
item.dc:creator: LCSwPaDmin
item.content:encoded:
Lodestar is a light that guides the way.

Our mission is to “empower children and families,” by providing necessary tools to develop and improve their own system for supporting their own needs, as they see and defines them.

Lodestar provides Home and Community Based (HCBS) and Children & Family Treatment & Support Services (CFTSS) for youth between the ages of 5-21 who are dealing with mental health challenges.

What We Do
Our Staff

Our Generous Sponsors

Our Executive Director, James Regan Jr., was featured in an article in the LI Advance to discuss Lodestar and our services! Click here to read it on their website!

LODESTAR NEWS

April 2022

Our Milestones for Mental Health Campaign was a huge success! Together, we walked 12 miles and raised awareness for the often invisible weight of mental illness.

Learn More Here!

FEBRUARY 2022

Lodestar is growing! We are currently looking for more staff members to help us better serve our youth! Join 50+ amazing workers changing lives in Brooklyn, Queens, Nassau, and Suffolk county!

Watch Our Video!

DECEMBER 2021

Lodestar has released our first Quarterly Newsletter! This newsletter will allow us to share exciting news, events, and ways to incorporate mental health into your daily routine. Keep your eyes out for all the amazing things happening at Lodestar!

Check Out Our Newsletter!

SEPTEMBER 2021

Lodestar had our first official in-person training since the start of the COVID-19 pandemic! While we are still being extremely cautious during these ever-changing times, being able to connect and share experiences under one roof after relying on virtual interactions for so long was extremely gratifying.

SUMMER 2021

Lodestar currently serves around 145 families in four counties. Our staff has grown to over 60 employees, some of which have begun working with clients in Brooklyn! Lodestar also added a new board member – thank you to Michelle Caminas, longtime supporter and donor, for sharing your expertise.

MAY 2020

Our fundraiser - Milestones for Mental Health - was a resounding success! Thanks to supporters like you, we were able to raise approximately $55,000, exceeding our goal! All of this money will go towards providing children with the beneficial services that they need to live fulfilling lives.

+
VIEW ALL

item.title: WHAT WE DO
item.dc:creator: LCSwPaDmin
item.content:encoded:
Lodestar Children's Services works with children and families through the NYS Office of Mental Health Home and Community Based (HCBS) waiver program and Children & Family Treatment Supports & Services (CFTSS) array. We are a designated provider of these services in Suffolk, Nassau and Queens Counties.

Lodestar's Competitive Advantage

Lodestar will surpass existing providers in the following key areas:

-A culture that is zealously anti-bureaucratic: For waiver services to succeed and be meaningful, programs must start with a lean structure that allows for the most funds to go to services. This is an imperative given the current rate structure.

-Attracting and Retaining High-caliber staff: Lodestar will pay higher wages, as well as use its existing network to identify and recruit high caliber staff. These costs will be offset by lower costs in other areas such as administrative and bricks and mortar costs. Lodestar will also teach and encourage people to maximize their time through development of engagement skills and emphasis on the importance of sustained and consistent intervention. All of these emphases will not only result in better service, but in higher employee satisfaction than the field.

-Real-time support tailored to needs: We will go out of our way to ensure families know we're there when they need us- for most of them, this means evening and weekend visits and a willingness to come out to a home on the spot. Similarly, we will recognize and honor the truism that more intensive services are needed in the beginning of an episode. Lodestar will meet this need through focused discussion with families and partner agencies towards careful tailoring of budgets and through seeking to begin services as soon as possible, independent of enrollment dates.

-Family choice: The current waiver system on Long Island does not show a true commitment to family preference. The most glaring example can be found in the lack of males performing this work (estimated at less than 10%), despite that the vast majority of waiver clients being male (estimated at around 67%) and having a preference for male workers. Lodestar will endeavor to match family cultural, age, and experiential preferences. This will be accomplished primarily through targeted hiring described above, but also through a commitment to empowerment philosophies.

-Meaningful intervention rooted in self-direction: Lodestar will encourage families to learn about and select from proven intervention systems. Lodestar will insist on a collective effort to intentionally focus services on accomplishing goals. Lodestar will do so through the honoring of family autonomy- especially families whose kids qualify for residential facilities but who have determined a different path. We recognize that they need to be empowered to make their own decisions with us serving as "consultants," not "bosses." However, the recommendation for structure and intentionality should be strong and persuasive

item.title: TESTIMONIALS
item.dc:creator: LCSwPaDmin
item.content:encoded:
James has always been a man who puts other first. Since I was 16 years old, he has been a great mentor of mine. I had been through a lot growing up and ended up in a group home. He was always there to guide me and help me overcome my trials and tribulations.

James has always had great character, morals, and value. He has never hesistated to help someone if they needed it. He always said he wanted to be able to give children the oppurtunity to grow, change, and make something of themselves. I believe he possesses the ability and knowledge to make this new program successful and change these children’s lives forever.

--Alex

James is an inspiration and an amazing person. I wholeheartedly recommend him as the "full package deal". An individual full of energy, enthusiasm, talent, and dedication, he has a passion for his clients and their families. I am thrilled to no end to have made James's acquaintance and to have had the opportunity with such a dedicated professional and gentleman.

This is the first time I've felt compelled enough to offer this highest form of accolade to a perfect professional. But again... I've never met anyone like James, either.

--Mohammed

In the past decade, I have known James as a boss, a colleague, and a friend. In that time, I have watched James engage in several facets of the mental and behavioral health systems as it relates to children and youth. One common thread through all of his involvement remains his conviction that things are never "good enough." James has worked in several systems to learn about the needs of children and families from every aspect possible and is always systematically evaluating the pros and cons to programs. He has always wanted to develop a unique program that can provide the best possible service to those it serves.

Lodestar is the result of a long-term, research-based passion to make available the absolute best service possible. I am excited to have been included in Lodestar's planning processes. Where other agencies may cut corners for convenience, James is cutting waste for the sake of optimal quality in service. I believe that you will find no better organization to meet your needs at the quality that you deserve. I stand behind Lodestar because I stand behind James, and I truly believe he is the best man for the job.

--Eric

item.title: LODESTAR NEWS
item.dc:creator: LCSwPaDmin
item.content:encoded:
APRIL/MAY 2022

Lodestar kicked off Mental Health Awareness Month with our 2nd Milestones for Mental Health event!

DECEMBER 2021

Welcome to our quarterly Newsletter! This newsletter will allow us to share exciting news, events, and ways to incorporate mental health into your daily routine. Keep your eyes out for all the amazing things happening at Lodestar!

Read It Here!

SUMMER 2021

Lodestar currently serves around 145 families in four counties. Our staff has grown to over 60 employees, some of which have begun working with clients in Brooklyn! Lodestar also added a new board member - thank you to Michelle Caminas, longtime supporter and donor, for sharing your expertise.

MAY 2021

Our fundraiser - Milestones for Mental Health - was a resounding success! Thanks to supporters like you, we were able to raise approximately $55,000, exceeding our goal! All of this money will go towards providing children with the beneficial services that they need to live fulfilling lives.

SUMMER 2020

Lodestar has surpassed the centennial mark, as we now work with over 100 families! This tremendous progress, amid, difficult and uncertain times, is a testament to our growing reputation as a premiere provider of high-quality in-home children's mental health services. Growth, growth, growth! Lodestar now employees ~45 staff members.

MARCH 2020

Lodestar has arrived in New York City, successfully expanding CFTSS and HCBS service offerings to Queens youth and their families!

JANUARY 2020

Lodestar has added a new Board member-- thank you to Kris Weinisch, a longtime donor, for volunteering your expertise towards supporting local children's mental health

FALL 2019

We are selling tickets for our upcoming REVERSE RAFFLE on 11/8 at the Babylon American Legion. Click here to learn how to support our cause and get a chance to win cash prizes!! You don't have to attend the event to win... but we hope to see you there! Only 300 raffle tickets sold-- so buy yours today!

AUGUST 2019

Lodestar has begun providing Youth Peer Support services to local families. This exciting new service is provided directly by adults who have been child recipients of mental health services. We have also completed contracts with several Managed Care organizations, expanding the scope of our services even further!

MARCH 2019

Lodestar is now an approved Medicaid provider and is accepting direct referrals! Email jregan@lodestarcs.org to learn more!​

NOVEMBER 2018

Are you an Amazon shopper? Use: https://smile.amazon.com/ch/81-1286372 and earn a .5% donation to Lodestar from Amazon on each purchase you make!

AUGUST 2018

Lodestar is now employing 24 workers, including 5 full-time to staff, to serve over 75 Suffolk County children! We are so thankful for the opportunity to expand our reach!!​

MAY 2018

We had an amazing evening with over 200 guests on-hand and over $20,000 raised. To learn more, take the time to view our amazing photos by Phyllis Henry and Sophia Pavlatos that captured out amazing evening on May 3rd.

APRIL 2018

Listen to our LIVE appearance on WRCN 103.9 "Your Island Live with Tom Schiliro,"as Lodestar leadership​ discusses the imperative need for more children's mental health support.​​

WINTER 2017

Lodestar is now employing 14 workers and serving over 40 Suffolk County children! We are so thankful for the opportunity to expand our reach!!​

item.title: Milestones for Mental Health
item.dc:creator: LCSwPaDmin
item.content:encoded:
Lodestar’s 5th Birthday Campaign • May 1st, 2021 at 7am

Lodestar is embarking on our biggest fundraising campaign yet. Will you help us reach our goal of $40,000?

6-8 volunteers will take the walk from Executive Director James Regan’s hometown of West Babylon to our office in Bohemia. We want this walk to symbolize how Lodestar has grown and the path that we have taken to get where we are today.

As we walk, we will also be carrying a painted stone for each of the children in our program. The weight of these stones will represent the invisible weight of mental illness.

Walkers will endeavor to raise $2,500 each to sponsor their walk.

Along the way, we will stop to thank some our corporate sponsors and record videos of our journey. At the end, we will have a small, COVID-safe outdoor gathering in Bohemia to celebrate our journey.

Why $40,000?

Lodestar currently pays, on average, an annual cost of $500 per child on activity fees. This cost used to be covered by the state, but since 2018, we have been paying for it ourselves. $40,000 will help cover these expenses.

Watch this video to learn more!

For more information on supporting our
event and services, please contact us at
(631) 767-1589

2021 Milestones for Mental Health Corporate Sponsors

Insperity®, a trusted advisor to America’s best businesses since 1986, provides an array of human resources and business solutions designed to help improve business performance. Learn how Insperity can help your business

Riverhead Building Supply ®, your best choice for building materials, supplies and services... Long Island and New England's choice for building supplies for 70 years.

item.title: Home
item.dc:creator: LCSwPaDmin
item.content:encoded:
Lodestar’s Milestone’s For Mental Health on 5/1 Was An Outstanding Success!

Check out Lodestar's journey across Long Island for our Milestones for Mental Health Fundraiser here!
Welcome to Lodestar

Children's Services!

Our mission is to “empower children and families,” by providing necessary tools to develop and improve their own system for supporting their own needs, as they see and defines them.

Lodestar provides Home and Community Based (HCBS) and Children & Family Treatment & Support Services (CFTSS) for youth between the ages of 5-21 who are dealing with mental health challenges.

​James Regan, Founder

What does LODESTAR mean?

1. A STAR THAT SHOWS THE WAY.

2. ...SERVES AS A GUIDE ON WHICH THE ATTENTION IS FIXED.

Who are we?

A new non-profit HCBS waiver provider to psychiatrically disabled youth ages 5-21 under NYS Office of Mental Health. Our mission is to “empower children and families.”

How do we do this?

...by supplying tools necessary to identify, develop and enhance a families' own system for supporting their needs as they define them....

2021 Milestones for Mental Health Corporate Sponsors


Read More

Assemblyman Mike LiPetri, American Legion Post 94 Commander Mike Hernandez, & Legislator Kevin McCaffery-- along with 250 other wonderful *& amazing guests at our November 2019 Fundraiser.

Happy Clients

TESTIMONIALS

James has always been a man who puts other first. Since I was 16 years old, he has been a great mentor of mine. I had been through a lot growing up and ended up in a group home. He was always there to guide me and help me overcome my trials and tribulations.

James has always had great character, morals, and value. He has never hesistated to help someone if they needed it. He always said he wanted to be able to give children the oppurtunity to grow, change, and make something of themselves. I believe he possesses the ability and knowledge to make this new program successful and change these children’s lives forever.
Alex
*
James is an inspiration and an amazing person. I wholeheartedly recommend him as the "full package deal". An individual full of energy, enthusiasm, talent, and dedication, he has a passion for his clients and their families. I am thrilled to no end to have made James's acquaintance and to have had the opportunity with such a dedicated professional and gentleman.

This is the first time I've felt compelled enough to offer this highest form of accolade to a perfect professional. But again... I've never met anyone like James, either.
Mohammed

LODESTAR NEWS

SUMMER 2021

Lodestar currently serves around 145 families in four counties. Our staff has grown to over 60 employees, some of which have begun working with clients in Brooklyn! Lodestar also added a new board member – thank you to Michelle Caminas, longtime supporter and donor, for sharing your expertise.

MAY 2020

Our fundraiser - Milestones for Mental Health - was a resounding success! Thanks to supporters like you, we were able to raise approximately $55,000, exceeding our goal! All of this money will go towards providing children with the beneficial services that they need to live fulfilling lives.

+

item.title: DONATE TO OUR CAUSE
item.dc:creator: LCSwPaDmin
item.content:encoded:
As a 501c3 charity, Lodestar is approved to received charitable donations. We rely heavily on this type of community support to make ends meet and, thanks to the generosity of our local community we are pleased to report having raised over $100K since our inception!

Lodestar Monthly All-Stars are people who recognize the need for our services and make a monthly recurring commitment to our cause! Choose your amount and click "monthly" to change the toggle button to "monthly" before clicking next. Thank you!!!!

item.title: JOB OPPORTUNITIES
item.dc:creator: LCSwPaDmin
item.content:encoded:
JOB OPPORTUNITIES

Lodestar Children's Services is always interested in hearing from qualified, interested individuals who can demonstrate they are committed to supporting children and families. Enthusiasm, creativity, flexibility and patience are tremendous assets to these roles.

CURRENT OPENINGS

In-Home Mental Health Support Specialist:

Part-time work with a child towards achieving age appropriate developmental tasks and developing specific social skills necessary for acceptable social interactions. Collaborate to design and provide activities that assist children in developing skills needed to live successfully in their homes. Help the child to identify current assets and strategies for acquiring new ones. Skill Builders may also work with the child’s family, including siblings, in teaching them how to best support the child in maintaining these skill sets. Activities may support areas such as completing schoolwork, being part of a team, handling money, activities of daily living, independent living skills and in accessing vocational skills training.

Qualifications:

  • be at least 18 years of age;
  • have experience working with children (experience with special needs children a plus);
  • high school diploma (college degree a plus)
  • clearance by the State Child Abuse Registry and fingerprinting for a criminal history
    background clearance
    --OR--
  • be staff of an OMH-certified Community Residence, including Crisis Residence

Salary: $22.50 - $26 per service hour (based on education, training and experience) Schedule : Dependent on the needs of the family/families you work with and variable. Most families are need/prefer after-school, weekday hours.

Resumes, along with a cover letter, may be submitted directly to James Regan, Executive Director, at jregan@lodestarcs.org.

item.title: CONTACT US
item.dc:creator: LCSwPaDmin
item.content:encoded: [contact-form-7 id="115" title="My form"]

item.title: 2022-23 FACILITY CAMPAIGN
item.dc:creator: LCSwPaDmin
item.content:encoded:
As a 501c3 charity, Lodestar is approved to receive charitable donations. We rely heavily on this type of community support to best provide for our clients and staff in order to make ends meet. We want to ensure our clients have the opportunity to feel empowered, and engage with the local community they live in. We want our staff to feel secure in their knowledge, and appreciated for their dedicated work.

Lodestar's current goal is to open a recreational center for our youth and we need your help to do so. Especially during the COVID-19 pandemic, it has become increasingly difficult to find public places for our clients to engage in recreational activities. We believe in the importance of having a safe space to learn life skills and develop lasting connections, but it is hard to do so without a space to call our own. Will you help us by donating today?

Thanks to the generosity of our local communities, we are pleased to report having raised over $200K since our inception! This is just the beginning, and we are hopeful for our future, and the future of the children we work with.

If you have any questions or want to obtain more information, do not hesitate to reach out to us at Info@lodestarcs.org or call (631) 767 1589.

item.title: Milestones for Mental Health
item.dc:creator: LCSwPaDmin
item.content:encoded:
Check us out live on Twitch today- https://twitch/tv/lodestarcs

Lodestar’s 5th Birthday Campaign

Lodestar reached our goal of $40,000 thanks to all of our amazing supporters and sponsors!

10 volunteers traveled from Babylon Town Hall to our office in Bohemia. We carried 130 rocks, one for each participant in our program, to give increased visibility to the often invisible illness that is mental illness. Many of the rocks we carried were painted by the youth in our program. Along the way, we were met by Lodestar staff and youth who cheered us on as we continued our 15 mile journey. We met individuals from all walks of life who were touched by the sheer strength of our youth. 

Why $40,000?

Lodestar currently pays, on average, an annual cost of $500 per child on activity fees. This cost used to be covered by the state, but since 2018, we have been paying for it ourselves. $40,000 will help cover these expenses.

Watch this video to learn more!

2021 Milestones for Mental Health Corporate Sponsors

The GEICO Philanthropic Foundation strives to support organizations that provide programs and resources to help strengthen diverse communities across the country. Over the past 40+ years, the Foundation has donated more than $139 million dollars to over 7 thousand charities across the country.

Visit their website

Insperity®, a trusted advisor to America’s best businesses since 1986, provides an array of human resources and business solutions designed to help improve business performance. Learn how Insperity can help your business

Visit their website

Plainview's More Than A Gym'snumber one goal is to see your child, with developmental delays and various abilities, experience what all children are entitled to… enjoy a fun and active life that is filled with excitement, self-confidence, and love

Visit their website

Established in 1994, Cafe Gio is a family owned and operated restaurant specializing in Italian cuisine. Our casual and friendly dining atmosphere makes us a neighborhood favorite. We offer free parking and local delivery.

Visit their website

Riverhead Building Supply ®, your best choice for building materials, supplies and services... Long Island and New England's choice for building supplies for 70 years.

Visit their website

Freedom Mortgage has grown to be one of the 6 largest mortgage lenders in the US. With 30 years of experience helping customers achieve and maintain the dream of homeownership, we are proud today to be the nation’s #1 VA and FHA lender.

Visit their website

NSA Insurance offers a different approach to your insurance and financial needs. We listen. We research. We have the expertise and knowledge to recommend a customized package built to suit your unique circumstances. We work as your partner to secure your assets for today while building them for tomorrow.

Visit their website

item.content:encoded: Lodestar’s 5th birthday campaign, Milestones for Mental Health, was a roaring success!

item.title: OUR STAFF
item.dc:creator: LCSwPaDmin
item.content:encoded:
Founder/Executive Director

James is a Licensed Social Worker successfully working with children and families since 2000. He has worked in the summer camp and social service industries in various aspects including: management, clinical and direct services. James' vision is to maximize the focus on the frontline within social service agencies towards more effective and lasting impacts on lives.

James is described by clients, employees, and fellow leaders as a team player, who easily cultivates solid rapport and can facilitate success with most anyone. He is also a practicing psychotherapist.

Contact JAMES

Program Director

Danielle W. has been a Program Supervisor since spring 2021 and was promoted to Program Director in August 2022. She holds two Master's degrees, one in General Psychology and one in School Psychology, both from Adelphi and a Bachelor's degree in Psychology and Sociology. She was recently selected for the Psychology Advanced Standing Doctoral program at Hofstra. Danielle has a strong passion for working with and helping children and adolescents. In her spare time, Danielle enjoys spending time with her friends and family (including those with 4 legs), traveling, and time outdoors. 

Program Manager

Danielle B. is our Program Manager. She graduated from Syracuse University in 2020 with a BS in Human Development and Family Sciences. She minored in Disability Studies and did coursework on Child & Youth Development, Play-Development & Early Education, among other topics.

Program Coordinators

Kayla earned her Master's of Social Work from Stony Brook University in May of 2020. She has interned at Nathaniel Woodhull Elementary School in Shirley, NY, and at Children's Home + Aid in Bloomington, IL. Kayla also has experience working as a Youth Development Professional at the Boys & Girls Club of Bloomington.

Maeling has been a Program Supervisor for Lodestar since December 2019 and was promoted to Program Coordinator in August 2022. She is a Licensed Clinical Mental Health Counselor, as well as a Certified Alcohol and Substance Abuse Counselor. She has seven years of experience providing children’s mental health services, including clinical services for foster children and mental health services for autistic young adults.

Yvette graduated from Adelphi University with her Master of Social Work in 2010. She has been working professionally with children and families for over ten years, including as a Health Care Integrator and a Waiver Service Provider. Along with her responsibilities at Lodestar, Yvette works as an OLP and as a Program Coordinator elsewhere.

Program Supervisors

Emalee is a SUNY Oneonta graduate majoring in anthropology and a minor certificate in positive psychology from Hanze University of Applied Sciences in Groningen, Netherlands. Emalee is looking to pursue a master's in Mental Health Counseling in the Fall of 2021 to further her career and ability in helping children and adults.

Danielle P. received her B.S. in Applied Psychology from New York University in May of 2018. During her time in university, and following her graduation, she worked as a tutor and teacher’s assistant in multiple locations, helping a wide age-range of students. She also worked as a one-on-one Community Habilitation Worker, providing home care and tutoring for a college-aged teenager. In her free time, Danielle loves to play video games, practice her violin and viola, travel, and play with her cat, Patches.

Allison K. is a recent graduate from Messiah University and currently practicing Mental Health Counseling in the community working towards licensure. She has a passion for serving families across Long Island and especially loves her work with children and youth. A California native, she loves the outdoors and especially relaxing in the sun. 

Assistant Program Supervisors

Erik graduated from Adelphi University in 2017 with a Master’s Degree in Elementary and Special Education. He is currently a full time Second Grade Teacher and Musical Choreographer for High School. Erik has always had a passion for helping and teaching others of all ages. He enjoys traveling, singing, dancing and being around friends and family.

Dorothy graduated with a Bachelor's in Psychology from SUNY Farmingdale. She is pursuing her Master's degree in Social Work from Stony Brook University. She provides PSR, RCS, and YPA for Lodestar. She has a wealth of experience with children with ID/DD and mental health difficulties.

Gina achieved a Master's Degree in Special Education/General Education from Dowling College and a Bachelor of Science in Elementary Education from Dowling. Gina prides herself in her ability to think outside of the box. Gina loves to read and encourages others to do so. Gina also loves spending time with her husband, their two daughters, and their big, loveable dog Teddy.

Alex graduated with his Master's in Social Work from Stony Brook University in May of2022. For his graduate field placement, he interned at Central Islip School District where he got to support the social-emotional needs of students in elementary, middle, and high school settings. He is passionate about social justice and is currently pursuing a career in school social work. In Alex's free time, he enjoys spending time with his two dogs, Bentley and Rocky, and fostering kittens for an animal rescue in Central Islip.

Anthony earned his undergraduate degree in Chemistry Education from Manhattan College and his graduate degree in Special Education from St. Peter's University. He am currently a full-time high school Chemistry Teacher and part-time Adjunct Professor. Anthony love working with his students and their families, travelling, and trying new foods. 

Daniella is finishing her last semester at CUNY Brooklyn College and will be achieving her Bachelor of Science in Psychology. Since 2018 she has worked as an after-school teacher, teacher's assistant, and a student mentor/intern and provided children of all ages a safe, friendly environment. Daniella cherishes the connections she has made with each of her students and ensures that they feel valued as individuals. Daniella is very passionate about helping children, mental health, and fitness.

Program Assistants

Alyssa graduated with her Bachelor’s Degree in Psychology in 2020 and is currently enrolled in a Master’s Program for Mental Health Counseling. She has a passion for helping others and has been working with children for many years as a babysitter, and field worker and is also a mother of two daughters.

Stephanie achieved a Master's Degree in Special Education from Queens College as well as a Bachelor of Science in Speech and Language Pathology.  She is passionate about working with children and she is most proud of her three beautiful children.

Kadin is currently attending Sarah Lawrence College to earn his Bachelor's Degree in Liberal Arts. He is working towards a career in animation, but also enjoys graphic design and critical psychology. Kadin loves using his skills in visual arts to spread awareness for causes that he is passionate about. He also works as a Website and Graphic Designer at Blue Umbrella Experience. In his free time, he likes playing games like Dungeons & Dragons and Pokémon.

Field Workers

Allison is a Stony Brook University graduate, majoring in psychology, currently pursuing her Master's degree at Adelphi University. She grew up babysitting and caring for her niece and nephew, giving her great experience with children. She is passionate about mental health, physical fitness, and encouraging healthy behaviors.

Tiffany has an associate's degree in Science from the Lincoln College of Technology. She is skilled in communication and building relationships with clients.

Darrell recently graduated from SUNY Buffalo with a Bachelor of Arts in Psychology and is ready to pursue his passion for helping those with mental health needs. Darrell completed one hundred hours of community service advocating for social justice and helping to provide education, clothes, and food to those in need.

Brianna J. earned her Bachelor of Arts in Psychology from Stony Brook University in May of 2021. Currently, she works with children ages 3 to 5 as an Educational Replacement Staff at Stony Brook Childcare Services. She also completed an internship at the Developmental Disabilities Institute in early 2021. In college, she was an active member of the Women’s Lacrosse Club and the Psi Chi Honor Society.

Cyla recently graduated from Kutztown University with a Bachelor's degree in Psychology and a minor in Business. She is currently pursuing her Master's in Forensic Psychology at Southern New Hampshire University. She is passionate about advocating for others' mental health and enjoys working out and being active!

Lotouria earned her Master's of Social Work from Long Island University Post in May of 2006. She has several years of experience in upper management and counseling in the non-profit sector. Lotouria has a strong passion for mental health. She has a wealth of expertise and experience involving families, children, substance abuse/alcohol, mental health, and gerontology.

Tricia earned her BA in Psychology from Stony Brook University in 2019. She is
currently pursuing a dual master’s degree in social work and public health at Stony
Brook University. Tricia has many years of experience working with children including
in daycare settings, babysitting, working with children with special needs, and being a
foster parent to vulnerable children. Outside of work, Tricia’s passions and hobbies
include wellness, mental health, fitness, cooking/baking, being active outdoors, and
going to the beach.

Eren graduated from Stony Brook University with a bachelor’s in Psychology in 2020. He strongly values mental health and loves being able to help others with it. His current plan is to continue his studies with a Masters program in the mental health field.

Chantel currently has her Master's in Social work from the University of South Carolina-Columbia. For two years, she has worked as a Youth Care Associate, member of the Race Equity Committee, and social worker for JCCA. In the past, she has also worked as a Residential Counselor for adolescents and a Rehabilitative Aide for people struggling with addiction. She also worked as a Human Services Specialist, conducting monthly in-home safety visits and helping families receive treatment services.

Heidi has a Bachelor of Science degree from Empire State College. While her degree is in Interdisciplinary Studies, her academic studies concentrated on Health and Healing. Heidi’s strengths lie in Holistic approaches. She is a certified yoga instructor and massage therapist and continues to work as a community leader for Breast Cancer Action. In the past, she has also worked with children as a school bus attendant.

Katerina received her Bachelor of Arts in Psychology from Queens College in December of 2020. She worked for two years as a babysitter at LA Fitness, supervising infants, toddlers, and young teenagers while their parents went to the gym. She prides herself on her ability to work well under pressure and multitask efficiently.

Renata graduated from St' Joseph's College with a Bachelor's in Community Health and Human Services in 2014. Even before then, she had a passion for working with kids, shown by her experience as both a Teacher's Assistant and a Childcare Provider. Alongside her duties at Lodestar, she currently works as a Case Manager for Supported Living at Concern for Independent Living.

Emilysia graduated from Adelphi University with a Master’s degree in School Psychology in 2021. She has worked with children of many different age levels as an assistant teacher, a camp counselor, and even a dance teacher! She also completed an internship at a school’s psychology department helping with counseling and consultations.

La Kesha studied Psychology at the University Of Maryland and then completed her BA in Psychology with a minor in Mental health at Southern New Hampshire University. She enjoys spending time with her children as well as working with children. La Kesha plans to start her Masters in Sociology in the spring of 2022 and eventually earn a PSYD or DSW.

Tanisha is a Daemen College Alumni, Majoring in Health Care Studies - Community  Health. Tanisha currently works in social services as a full-time Senior Case Manager.  Tanisha has a passion for working with children who are challenged by various circumstances. Tanisha loves working with children and enjoys helping children explore new experiences.

Lovejeet graduated from St. John's University with a Bachelor's degree in Psychology in 2019. After graduating, he worked as a Youth Development Specialist, helping youth aged 12-18 with daily living and coping skills. Currently, along with his work at Lodestar, he works as a Family Specialist , creating discharge plans and delivering counseling services to those in need.

Sarah is working towards getting a Bachelor's degree in Applied Psychology. Sarah has joined Lodestar because she has a drive for mental health advocacy.

Jolie is currently working towards her Bachelor's of Arts in Psychology at Stony Brook University. She has over four years of experience working with babies, toddlers, and young children as a caregiver. She also has experience working with children with developmental disabilities.

Kate recently graduated from SUNY Oneonta with a Bachelor’s degree in Psychology. She is currently working toward getting her Master's degree in Mental Health Counseling. Kate has a passion for working with children as she has experience
working at a daycare and as a behavioral technician. Kate loves the beach, trying new
foods, and advocating for mental health.

Theodhora received her Bachelor’s degree in Psychology from CUNY York College. She is skilled in providing mental health interventions in a trauma-informed and culturally competent manner. She has experience working with pediatric and homeless populations. She is passionate about breaking the stigma associated with mental health issues within immigrant
communities. She hopes to go to graduate school to support the integration of mental health into medical care.

Lindsey has her Bachelor's from SNHU in Psychology with a specialization in childhood and adolescent development. She is working towards her Master's in Clinical Mental Health Counseling. Lindsey has worked in daycares as a lead teacher and knew that she wanted to work with children since she was 5. She enjoys reading, music, hiking, yoga, and meditation.

Julia graduated Summa Cum Laude from SUNY Oswego’s Honors Program with a
Bachelor’s of Arts in Psychology. She was a part of Oswego’s counseling outreach peer
educator team and was an advocate for students’ mental health on campus. Julia has
four younger sisters and has been babysitting for family members, friends, and people
in her community for the past 5 years. She is passionate about helping others, mental
health, and learning.

Gabriela earned her Bachelor of Science in Psychology at Stony Brook University and is continuing her education there to receive her Master's in Social Work. She has had multiple jobs and internships working with youth, including work with preschoolers and developmentally disabled children. She is also fluent in Spanish!

Alexander graduated from Saint Joseph's College in 2021 with a Bachelor's of Arts in Sociology. He is currently continuing his studies at Stony Brook University with the hopes of graduating with a Masters in Social work in 2024. Alexander is an animal lover, having worked as a kennel assistant and obedience trainer and currently working as a veterinary assistant alongside his responsibilities at Lodestar!

Caitlyn graduated from Loyola University with a Bachelor of Arts in Psychology in May of 2022, and is currently pursuing her Masters in Mental Health Counseling at Hofstra University. She has worked with both children and teenagers in tutoring settings, helping them with math and reading comprehension. Currently, she works for HearMe, an anonymous chatline for individuals seeking support. In her free time, she likes performing acapella and dancing.

Raina is a recent college graduate from St. Joseph College where she earned a Bachelor's in Psychology. She graduated with Magna Cum Laude honors as well as holding a position as secretary of the Psi Chi National Honors Society. During her college career, Raina became a mother to her beautiful son Koda who was gifted with an extra chromosome. When she was informed of her son’s diagnosis it became her mission to spread awareness and advocate and support those with special needs. She does this by sharing her son’s journey on social media with the hopes of eliminating the negative stigmas surrounding Down Syndrome and other various types of special needs. Some of Raina's favorite things to do are to go on long walks, visit local farms and zoos with her son, and cook fun, toddler-approved nutritious snacks and meals that both her son and she can enjoy together.

Alexandra earned her B.A. in Psychology with a minor in Social Work from SUNY Old Westbury in 2021. She worked as a mentor at the Sangha Education Center inOld Westbury and as an Aftercare Worker for the St. Joseph's College Bears. Alex has a passion for creative arts- from art to music to photography, as well as sports.

Brianna M. has recently graduated from SUNY Plattsburgh with a Bachelor of Arts degree
in Psychology in May of 2022. She has worked with children as a camp counselor and after-school program aid. She has decided to pursue psychology because she has the desire for
helping others with mental health challenges. Brianna intends on going back to school to obtain
a master’s degree in clinical mental health counseling.

Holly graduated with her Bachelor of Arts in Psychology from SUNY Geneseo. She has extensive experience in her field, including past work as a Childcare Volunteer and a Case Manager. She has also been a Research Assistant for work on children's psychology. Currently, she works as a Mental Health Counselor Intern and as a Behavior Technician for children with autism.

Nicole graduated from Fordham University's Graduate School of Social Science in December of 2018. She has nearly ten years of experience in care management, counselling, and social work at multiple agencies, including a current job at Advance Care Alliance. She is also trained in Therapeutic Crisis Intervention and is a member of the National Association of Social Workers!

Nicole just recently graduated from Stony Brook University in May of 2022 with a Bachelor of Arts degree. Majoring in Psychology and Sociology, Nicole's studies focused primarily on children and women's studies. For two years she was a Home Health Aide for her mother, helping her with everyday tasks that were difficult due to her mother's disability.

Dayna earned her Bachelor of Science in Child and Family Studies from SUNY Oneonta in May of 2016, and has just recently begun to pursue her Master of Science in Adolescent Special Education at Pace University. She has worked as a Child Protective Specialist at the NYC Administration for Children's Services, and has recently been selected by the NYC Department of Education to work as a NYC Teaching Collaborative Partner Teacher in an alternative certification program.

Emma P. graduated with her Bachelor of Science from CUNY Hunter College and has nearly five years of child care experience. She previously worked as a Daycare Assistant Teacher, helping children learn and preparing healthy meals for them. She has also been a Private Nanny since 2018, and continues this job alongside her responsibilities at Lodestar. Emma is also fluent in Spanish!

Bianca has her B.S from Sacred Heart University in Psychology and Criminal Justice. She is working towards her M.S in Clinical Mental Health Counseling at Pace University. Bianca has extensive experience in career counseling undergraduate students and working with eating disorder
patients aged 7-26 at Center For Discovery. On her time off Bianca loves to cook, teach people how to cook, paddleboard, hike, read, and garden.

Jillian graduated from Ithaca College in 2021 with her Master’s degree in Occupational
Therapy. She works as a school-based OT, and is very passionate about helping
children feel comfortable and confident in their abilities. In her free time, Jillian loves to
hike, bake, and dance!

Angelique graduated from John Jay College of Criminal Justice in 2020 with a
Bachelor’s Degree in Forensic Psychology. She has experience working with adults and
children. Angelique has a strong passion for mental health and helping those who need,
she cherishes the connections she makes with everyone she has and will work with.
Angelique enjoys traveling, cooking, fitness and being around friends and family.

item.title: Milestones for Mental Health 2022
item.dc:creator: LCSwPaDmin
item.content:encoded:
Our event was a huge success! We met with so many amazing supporters and spread the word about Lodestar to many new faces! Remember, though: the journey isn't over! Lodestar's goal is to raise $150,000 by the end of 2022 in order to help us open a recreational facility for our youth! If you can, please donate, and continue to spread the word about our cause!

NOTE: Lodestar has raised over $92,000 in donations, grants, and pledges to date towards our goal of a community center in 2023. This meter only reflects donations made through Lodestar's website.

WHAT IS MILESTONES FOR MENTAL HEALTH?

Milestones for Mental Health is an annual fundraiser in which Lodestar volunteers take a journey to spread awareness for mental health. We walk 12 miles together, carrying rocks to signify the weight that mental illness has upon our clients. At each mile, we drop some of the rocks to signify the way in which our services help to relieve that weight. We also meet up with supporters and sponsors to give thanks! This year's event is on April 30, 2022. Contact Danielle at info@lodestarcs.org to get involved!

WHAT'S DIFFERENT THIS YEAR?

We will be livestreaming the event on TWITCH, with interactive elements so that our supporters at home can stay involved!

Our goal this year is bigger than ever: $150,000!

WHY $150,000?

Lodestar’s biggest goal is to open a recreational center for our youth. Most of the money from this event will go towards finally making this dream a reality! Donations will go towards increasing staff training and bettering the lives of our youth through community-building events, aid for families, and other necessary expenses.

Click Here to Watch Last Year's Recap Video!

wp:postmeta.wp:meta_value: <iframe title="Milestones For Mental Health Walk 2022" width="500" height="281" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/ggTWdeXp9pA?feature=oembed" frameborder="0" allow="accelerometer; autoplay; clipboard-write; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture" allowfullscreen></iframe>

item.title: 2022-23 FACILITY CAMPAIGN
item.dc:creator: LCSwPaDmin
item.content:encoded:
As a 501c3 charity, Lodestar is approved to receive charitable donations. We rely heavily on this type of community support to best provide for our clients and staff in order to make ends meet. We want to ensure our clients have the opportunity to feel empowered, and engage with the local community they live in. We want our staff to feel secure in their knowledge, and appreciated for their dedicated work.

Lodestar's current goal is to open a recreational center for our youth and we need your help to do so. Especially during the COVID-19 pandemic, it has become increasingly difficult to find public places for our clients to engage in recreational activities. We believe in the importance of having a safe space to learn life skills and develop lasting connections, but it is hard to do so without a space to call our own. Will you help us by donating today?

Thanks to the generosity of our local communities, we are pleased to report having raised over $200K since our inception! This is just the beginning, and we are hopeful for our future, and the future of the children we work with.

If you have any questions or want to obtain more information, do not hesitate to reach out to us at Info@lodestarcs.org or call (631) 767 1589.

item.title: WHAT WE DO
item.dc:creator: LCSwPaDmin
item.content:encoded:
What do we do?

​​Lodestar Children’s Services was created to work with youth and families in their homes.  That's our simple goal.  We are focused on trying to prevent youth from having to reside out of their homes.

We work with children and families through the NYS Office of Mental Health and Department of Health and provide services in Suffolk, Nassau, Queens, and Brooklyn.  We work with youth aged 0 to 21. Lodestar is often instrumental in changing the trajectories of their lives by being the proactive answer.

Youth have the right to have their needs supported from day one, and should not feel forced in\to institutionalization or placement out of the home. We believe in a ‘strengths-based’ approach, where, together, we come up with goals to capitalize on their existing strengths. This allows our clients to recognize their value and believe in the person they are. Lodestar empowers the children from the comfort of their home and emerges them in their community.

What are the services we provide?

Home & Community-Based Services:

  • Respite Care 
  • Prevocational Services
  • Caregiver Support
  • Community Self-Advocacy Treatment & Supports
  • Supported Employment

Children Family Treatment & Support Services:

  • Other Licensed Practitioners (OLP)
  • Community Psychiatric Supports and Treatment (CPST)
  • Psychosocial Rehabilitation (PSR)
  • Youth Peer Supports & Services (YPA)
  • Family Peer Support Services (FPSS)

Can any child enroll?

We primarily serve youth with 1. Medicaid and 2. an active Behavioral Health Diagnosis.  Lodestar is able to help assess the need for services and diagnose, if necessary. 

For children that do not have Medicaid, there are mechanisms for these youth to receive services from Lodestar– generally, a high level of need is required.  Contact us to learn more or your local county’s SPOA (Single Point of Access).  

How do you send a referral?

Contact referrals@lodestarcs.org and we can give you more information on the referral process.

item.title: BOARD OF DIRECTORS
item.dc:creator: LCSwPaDmin
item.content:encoded:
Who runs Lodestar?

Lodestar is governed by a volunteer group of Board of Directors who give their time freely towards our mission's best interest.  

Christen Lambert, President

Christen is a business developer specializing in Mergers & Acquisitions, who brings professional knowledge of banking, capital raising, budgeting, and forecasting to our team.

Her call to be a part of Lodestar comes from extensive experience working at and with non-profit organizations, particularly in the social service sector.

Jay Able, Treasurer

Jay is Director of Purchasing / Contract Administrator, leading comprehensive procurement activities for a major local infrastructure firm. His former skill set as a Director of IT and Corporate Assets Manager lends additional competencies.

He is an active community leader and committed to creating a top-notch resource for children and families in need.

Fred Kortmann

Fred is an accomplished entrepreneur, CEO, and CFO, with over 45 years of experience in ​identifying, executing, and managing business ventures in a variety of fields.

As a father of four and a civically-minded citizen, he is vested in the idea of creating more opportunities for local youth to receive needed programs and services.​

Kris Weinisch 

Kris has been a financial supporter of Lodestar since its inception. He is a financial representative at Northwestern Mutual and is of an altruistic mindset in seeking always to help others. Among his other civic-minded pursuits, he is currently on the Babylon Chamber of Commerce board.

Hon. Clifton Nembhard, Secretary

Cliff is presently serving as a Judge in NYC’s Housing Court. He has been a member of the NY State Bar Association since 1999 and has extensive legal experience in both public and private sectors.

He is passionate about making a positive impact on the child welfare system and improving the lives of families in his community.

Michele Caminas

Michele joined our Board in early 2021, but she has been a loyal volunteer for the past 6 years. She owns her own daycare in Sayville called New Kids on the Block, which was founded in 2010 after ten years of teaching elementary and middle school kids.

Her passion for working with kids and experience managing her own company is valued here at Lodestar.

item.title: METS TICKETS RAFFLE
item.dc:creator: LCSwPaDmin
item.content:encoded:
The 2002 raffle for SIX (6) NY METS LUXURY BOX TICKETS has sold out! Good luck to all of our entrants.

The drawing is on July 31, 2022.

ALL PROCEEDS go towards Lodestar, an approved 501c3 organization!

One winner will be randomly selected and announced at 12:00pm EST on Aug 1st.

Tickets and amenities donated by

HAUGLAND GROUP!

www.hauglandgroup.us
